meanings.definition: Make something look more attractive or stylish.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys tittivating her room with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer spent hours tittivating the living room.
meanings.sent3: After tittivating the garden, it looked like a beautiful paradise.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress tittivated her appearance at the party.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes tittivated the plain canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To make small improvements to something in order to make it look more attractive.
meanings.sent1: He was tittivating his car by adding shiny new rims.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was tittivating the dress with delicate lace trim.
meanings.sent3: The chef was tittivating the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent4: The decorator was tittivating the room with elegant curtains.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was tittivating the flowerbeds with colorful blooms.

meanings.definition: To make small changes to something in order to improve its appearance.
meanings.sent1: She was tittivating the website by updating the layout.
meanings.sent2: The artist was tittivating the painting by adding more details.
meanings.sent3: The stylist was tittivating the outfit with a statement accessory.
meanings.sent4: The homeowner was tittivating the garden by planting new flowers.
meanings.sent5: The designer was tittivating the logo by adjusting the colors.
